One of the most well thought out and executed games I've ever played, I absolutely loved the new mechanics along with learning a bit more of the lore.

A worthy successor! Making a sequel of a game as timeless as Portal could end up tragically bad and generate a product way below anyone's expectations. Luckily the creators managed not only to extract the best parts of the original game, but also implemented a ton of new mechanics and an interesting story. Impressive! Worth every minute.

This game is an experience which cannot be missed.
Have you ever wanted to be in a lab being forced to do tests by a giant robot insulting you as you go?
Well this is the right game for You!
The campaign is fun, not incredibly confusing and even has depth in it if you don't get distracted by the comedic nature of the game.
As well as the campaign, there is the 'co-operative' multiplayer. You will die.. a lot.. (Mainly to your friends on purpose) But don't worry you can respawn as much as you want.
And the final thing I'll just quickly add, is that for the graphics (which are actually very pleasant) it ran really well on my old potato laptop, so yeah, it runs well too if that's a concern for anyone.
Can't describe how good this is. Goes on sale quite frequently. Get it and play it.

Un juego con una dinámica simple que puede llegar a ser repetitiva, pero junto al carisma de sus personajes con sus dialogos, lo hace uno de los mejores videojuegos que conozco. Sabe combinar puzzles, dificultad, diversión y una historia única que dota a este título de su propia personalidad.
This game is one of my favorite games. The story is amazing, the gameplay is great. I would recomend this game to play by yourself or with a friend.

Portal 2 is the best way to follow up the original Portal. You take a step back from the friendly environment and discover a whole new level of Aperture facility. You learn the roots of the game and you get to play through a great story, all while you solve puzzles with your portal gun.

Al principio yo no le tenia mucha fe a este juego, pero desde hace tiempo que tenia ganas de jugar un puzzle y como lo vi barato por las ofertas de medio año lo compre. Los mejores 5 soles invertidos de mi vida, a pesar que la historia es relativamente corta, te atrapa bastante, algunos niveles pueden ser verdaderamente desafiantes y el modo online es una joya porque te permite crear tus propios desquiciados laberintos y publicarlos para que las personas los intenten resolver. The game utilises the Source Engine and will run on almost anything.

*!*MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS FOR THE GAME*!*
For the people who want to know my reasoning for my high praise of Portal 2 let me enlighten you. 
Without spoiling anything you are a test subject that is tasked to solve a series of, complex, well thought out puzzles using the signature Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device. 
When I say "thought out" I really mean it. The game teaches you how to use different techniques without tutorials (which is something Valve does well in most of their games) by using great level design alone. This makes the player feel smart instead of having solutions bashed into your skull. And all this infomation is required for the finale, and I remembered all of it because it felt like I taught myself how to play instead of pesky tutorials.
The humour is amazing. Glados is hilarious, Wheatly is funny to laugh at, interactions between Atlas and P-body are amazing, the self-awareness of the turrets is hilarious and my personal favourite... the defective turrets.
I've played the majority of the multiplayer and, again, it's well designed. I'm not sure why this is but my favourite thing about the multiplayer is the Tab feature. Holding down Tab on the keyboard brings up a livefeed of what your teammate sees on the bottom righthand corner of your screen, it's relatively high quality and has an alright framerate. This is amazing if you think about it, the server has to deliver you a high quality stream of your teammates view (who could live on the other side of the planet) with minimal delay and no lag to the server. Speaking of servers, Portal 2's multiplayer servers are probably one of the most stable servers I've seen.

My only problems with the game is that I wish more puzzles could be solved in different ways, most of them can but some can't. This strips away the player's freedom and doesn't make the puzzle fun. I'm talking about the actual test rooms, not the parts of the game where you are elsewhere. My second problem with Portal 2 is the whole "Find the distant white wall to progress" issue, which is only really when you enter old Aperature and the only way to progress is finding that barely visable white wall that's hundreds of metres away, on a weird angle and might even be poorly lit which will make make you mistake it for a grey wall instead. I also had some crashes and freezes but that is most likely my computer and not the game.

Thank for reading if you made it this far into the review :)

This game fires on all cylinders.  The comedy writing is some of the best in gaming, the puzzles are challenging and thought provoking, and an interesting story considering the only person in the entire is mute.  After playing it several times, I know I'll still play it again.
